snippet: A bill that would undercut the police commissioner’s power to discipline abusive officers is troublesome. Gov. Andrew Cuomo should veto it.
abstract: Editorial urges New York Gov Andrew Cuomo to veto bill on police misconduct that would make it much harder for New York City Police Commissioner William Bratton to discipline officers; contends bill not only undercuts Bratton's power to rein in abusive officers, but also protects such officers from being accountable to civil liberties violations.
lead_paragraph: A bill that would undercut the police commissioner’s power to discipline abusive officers is troublesome. Gov. Andrew Cuomo should veto it.
